title: Parallel Lines - Find x
svg: <svg width="700" height="500" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><g transform="translate(0,200)"><line x1="60" y1="60" x2="320" y2="260" stroke="black" stroke-width="2" /><line x1="40" y1="120" x2="360" y2="120" stroke="black" stroke-width="2" /><line x1="40" y1="200" x2="360" y2="200" stroke="black" stroke-width="2" /><text x="370" y="122" font-family="STIX Two Math, STIX Math, Cambria Math, 'Latin Modern Math', 'TeX Gyre Termes Math', 'Times New Roman', serif" font-size="16" font-style="italic">𝑚</text><text x="370" y="202" font-family="STIX Two Math, STIX Math, Cambria Math, 'Latin Modern Math', 'TeX Gyre Termes Math', 'Times New Roman', serif" font-size="16" font-style="italic">𝑛</text><text x="60" y="55" font-family="STIX Two Math, STIX Math, Cambria Math, 'Latin Modern Math', 'TeX Gyre Termes Math', 'Times New Roman', serif" font-size="16" font-style="italic">ℓ</text><text x="135" y="113" font-family="Georgia" font-size="12" font-style="italic" text-anchor="start">128°</text><text x="240" y="193" font-family="Georgia" font-size="16" font-style="italic" text-anchor="start">x°</text></g></svg>
question: Find the value of x°.

stepQuestions.question: Is the given angle (128°) a big angle (obtuse) or a small angle (acute)?
stepQuestions.hint: Little angles are < 90° and big angles are > 90°.

stepQuestions.question: Is x a big angle (obtuse) or a small angle (acute)?
stepQuestions.hint: Little angles are < 90° and big angles are > 90°.

stepQuestions.question: Are the two angles the same size.
stepQuestions.hint: When a transversal intersects two parallel lines, all small angles are equal and all big angles are equal.

stepQuestions.question: How big is angle x?
stepQuestions.hint: Since the two angles are both big angles, look at the given angle.
